channel.title: GoDaddy
channel.description: Okay, I think this is the right place to put this. :| Okay, so, I created 3 subdomains using godaddy. The thing is, that none of them work. It's supposed to go to the folder I choose or w\e, but instead of going to the folder or something, it just says "Sorry, the site is not currently available." Is there anything I should do, besides call them? I don't like calling them, I'm 14. :p [b]EDIT:[/b]Now, they all redirect to my forums... Could it be because of my .htaccess file?

item.title: GoDaddy
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

[quote=“austinsobes, post:6, topic:395368”][quote author=sageofmali link=topic=492553.msg3601386#msg3601386 date=1305599159]

I’d help since I had hosting problems with go daddy. But I’m afraid I can’t help you. Because I don’t think you know what you are asking. Unless I’m confused, you should try to find out exactly whats wrong. Because hosting a site is a bit more than pointing GoDaddy at your websites file directory.
[/quote]They now all redirect to /ipb instead of what I want them to. Could it be my .htaccess file? My htaccess file redirects sagescapepk.com to /ipb. What should I do?

When I click on your website in your Signature, everything works fine. It points to /ipb because that’s the forum’s ‘callsign’. Much like you cannot access a file inside of your C:\System\ file without \System. /ipb/ websites can’t be accessed without /ipb/ because /ipb/ is more or less of a placeholder for all of the systems components, modules, etc…

In easier terms.
Think of /ipb/ as a sandwhich. If you have peanut butter and jelly and bread. You have peanut butter and jelly and bread. But when you put them together you have an sandwhich.
You have a website. Buttons. Threads. And when you put them together. You have /ipd/

EITHER WAY. Everything is fine and working.

No, no, no. Lmfao. I’m talking about my subdomains… hiscore.sagescapepk.com, forum.sagescapepk.com, ipb.sagescapepk.com they all go to /ipb/.

Well don’t I feel silly. Though my specialty is nowhere near networking and stuff. I’d imagine that your subdomains are set to redirect to /ipb/. When I had a website a few years ago, I had my main domain _.com. And then I had a few subdomains ___..com that were set to automatically redirect to my main domain. Other than that small bit of info. I’m not really sure. As I said, networking and web is not my forte.[/quote]

[code]hiscore
/hiscores
Setup

ipb
/ipb
Setup
[/code]
They all don’t point to /ipb/…

Read full topic

When I click on your website in your Signature, everything works fine. It points to /ipb because that’s the forum’s ‘callsign’. Much like you cannot access a file inside of your C:\System\ file without \System. /ipb/ websites can’t be accessed without /ipb/ because /ipb/ is more or less of a placeholder for all of the systems components, modules, etc…

Think of /ipb/ as a sandwhich. If you have peanut butter and jelly and bread. You have peanut butter and jelly and bread. But when you put them together you have an sandwhich.

Well don’t I feel silly. Though my specialty is nowhere near networking and stuff. I’d imagine that your subdomains are set to redirect to /ipb/. When I had a website a few years ago, I had my main domain _.com. And then I had a few subdomains ___..com that were set to automatically redirect to my main domain. Other than that small bit of info. I’m not really sure. As I said, networking and web is not my forte.

Read full topic
